definition: to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Often, the delayed signals will be slightly pitch shifted to more realistically convey the effect of multiple voices.
sentences.chinese: 经常，延迟的信号会被移调以产生和原始信号的和音。

sentences.english: The transposing arm is easily removable by loosening screw on side of arm.
sentences.chinese: 移调手臂的移动很容易通过放松手臂一侧的螺钉。

sentences.english: In Brush it is reached by use of tool Transpose.
sentences.chinese: 这是在刷达成的工具移调使用。

sentences.english: Except Operatic Aria, transposing is allowed or solo pieces.
sentences.chinese: 除歌剧咏叹调外，独唱歌曲允许移调演唱。

definition: (music) to change key/modulation/(of an employee) to be transferred to another post
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
tone mark on a Chinese syllable (i.e. accents on ā á ǎ à)/(music) key signature
(music) accidental (a note foreign to the key signature)
